item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
Very cool work from Picower Institute's Steve Flavell and colleagues.From molecular to whole-brain scale in a simple animal, study reveals serotonin’s effects
https://picower.mit.edu/news/molecular-whole-brain-scale-simple-animal-study-reveals-serotonins-effects

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
More evidence for a rhythmic basis of working memory. Different items in different beta (25 Hz) phases. Theta coordinates beta,Rhythmic temporal coordination of neural activity prevents representational conflict during working memory
https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cub.2023.03.088

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
The next day, there was a party and jam session in honor of the end of Brad Postle's sabbatical at BrownBrad Postle - guitar, vox
Michael Frank - drums
Earl Miller - bassNot pictured:
Chris Moore - harmonica. vox.
Patricia Mulvey - vox

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
A jam to celebrate the end of Brad Postle's sabbatical at BrownBrad Postle, Pat Mulvey, Michael Frank, Earl Miller
Providence 5-12-23

item.title: Total Internal Reflection
item.description: New posting! And another one dealing with me #LeavingAcademia as part of the #GreatResignation. This one has a slightly broader focus - why it's sometimes right to walk away, and that staying isn't always the best course of action. I've a feeling that #careers in #academia will struggle to stand up to scrutiny in this post-pandemic work environment. See what you think (as ever, comments always welcome!) https://totalinternalreflectionblog.com/2023/05/14/walk-away/

item.title: John Scott-Railton☕
item.description: Impersonation on #Twitter is out of control.I count over 140 fakes of just one user: Alex Gladstein of the Human Rights Foundation.The fakes block Alex so he can't see them when he searches for himself. #spam #bots #cybersecurity #humanrights #bitcoin

item.title: Dan Birman
item.description: Paper thread! I've been working on this project with Kai Fox and Justin Gardner for almost five years now, excited to see it in print! https://elifesciences.org/articles/78392This is a story about human spatial attention and how the visual system might tweak neural representations to implement attention. For the last decade or so, a lot of scientists studying visual attention have argued that changes in the tuning of neurons underlies improved performance when you "focus" attention. 1/9

item.description: It is time for my semi annual call for recommendations for places to pay to get microbial sequencing done (amplicon, genomes, metagenomes, RNAseq, etc).

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description:
To more effectively treat the brain, you need to account for and exploit its own rhythms.Closed-Loop Deep Brain Stimulation for Psychiatric Disorders
https://journals.lww.com/hrpjournal/Abstract/2023/05000/Closed_Loop_Deep_Brain_Stimulation_for_Psychiatric.6.aspx

item.title: eLife
item.description:
Read the first update on our new publishing model. With consistent submissions and positive feedback, we’re pleased to be starting strong and are excited to see how these changes begin to impact the wider publishing ecosystem.
https://elifesciences.org/inside-elife/739ce507/elife-s-new-model-initial-three-month-update?utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=organic

item.title: NavinPokala
item.description: Congratulations to Susan Marqusee, the incoming director of the NSF Biology Directorate! Susan is a brilliant scientist, and thoughtful mentor and advisor. This is great news for America and the world! https://news.berkeley.edu/2023/05/16/chemist-susan-marqusee-takes-leading-role-at-national-science-foundation/

item.title: Carl Zimmer
item.description: I've got two stories on our origins today. 1) Our species started as a patchwork of peoples across Africa. 2) To understand how our ancestors became animals, consider the comb jelly! 1) https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/17/science/human-origins-africa.html 2) https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/17/science/first-animals-comb-jellies.html

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
@markuswerle
I’m open to all interpretations. Determinism doesn’t seem implausible to me. But I find the ideas of @WiringtheBrain very compelling:
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/29961596/

item.title: Virginia Dignum
item.description:
Join us in this important conversation on #regulation #AI.
Looking at what is happening in the US senate, I'm not afraid of AI being out of control but terrified we are loosing control on those companies that develop it.Want to know more about the Future of AI in Europe? We're hosting an event in the EU parliament on 25 May #ResponsibleAI #AIactWebsite: webpage:
https://www.humane-ai.eu/event/humaneai-parliament/
Register by May 23 to get the streaming link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfOc3iy3zznBJs6p16mF4abdINbWqUYDc1kbl4Hv7NxWwGW8A/viewform
